articles.headline: In Aleppo, Residents Cheer and Refugees Return to a Jubilant but Ravaged City
articles.snippet: Though excitement and frenzy were on full display in some parts of Aleppo, the city is still gripped by uncertainty after the sudden end of a 13-year civil war.
articles.abstract: Though excitement and frenzy were on full display in some parts of Aleppo, the city is still gripped by uncertainty after the sudden end of a 13-year civil war.
articles.lead_paragraph: The many monuments of the Assad regime that once dotted the Syrian city of Aleppo have been toppled, torn or burned.
articles.byline: By Raja Abdulrahim and Ivor Prickett

articles.headline: Power, Intimidation and the Resurrection of Trump’s Support for Hegseth
articles.snippet: The president-elect became convinced that letting Pete Hegseth fail would set off a feeding frenzy among senators. What followed was a MAGA swarm that helped salvage his bid, at least for now.
articles.abstract: The president-elect became convinced that letting Pete Hegseth fail would set off a feeding frenzy among senators. What followed was a MAGA swarm that helped salvage his bid, at least for now.
articles.lead_paragraph: Just last week, Pete Hegseth was twisting in the wind.
articles.byline: By Jonathan Swan and Maggie Haberman

articles.headline: How America Created the Enemy It Feared Most
articles.snippet: The United States killed its own allies, sabotaging itself in a part of Afghanistan where it never needed to be.
articles.abstract: The United States killed its own allies, sabotaging itself in a part of Afghanistan where it never needed to be.
articles.lead_paragraph: The Taliban war hero scans the crowd, searching. From the back, he snatches a man with a flop of dusty hair and a face marred by shrapnel.
articles.byline: By Azam Ahmed and Bryan Denton

articles.headline: Biden Commutes the Sentences of 1,500 Americans, a Record for One Day
articles.snippet: Most of those being granted clemency had been placed in home confinement during the pandemic. Some Republicans have tried to push legislation that would have forced those people to return to prison.
articles.abstract: Most of those being granted clemency had been placed in home confinement during the pandemic. Some Republicans have tried to push legislation that would have forced those people to return to prison.
articles.lead_paragraph: President Biden said on Thursday that he is commuting the sentences of nearly 1,500 people and pardoning 39 people convicted of nonviolent crimes in a sweeping act of clemency during his final weeks in office.

articles.headline: Ev Williams Was Lonely. He Doesn’t Want You to Be.
articles.snippet: The serial internet entrepreneur, who co-founded Twitter and created Medium, was turning 50 and feeling detached from friends. Maybe a new start-up could fix that.
articles.abstract: The serial internet entrepreneur, who co-founded Twitter and created Medium, was turning 50 and feeling detached from friends. Maybe a new start-up could fix that.
articles.lead_paragraph: Evan Williams did not want to start another start-up. He had already enjoyed the kind of rare, unfathomable success most entrepreneurs only dream of, starting tech companies that made products used by millions — the early blogging site Blogger, the social media giant Twitter, the publishing platform Medium.

articles.headline: A Symbol of India’s Global Soft Power Stumbles After U.S. Indictments
articles.snippet: Countries in Asia, Africa and elsewhere have been distancing themselves from Gautam Adani, the Indian magnate, after accusations of bribery and conspiracy by American prosecutors.
articles.abstract: Countries in Asia, Africa and elsewhere have been distancing themselves from Gautam Adani, the Indian magnate, after accusations of bribery and conspiracy by American prosecutors.
articles.lead_paragraph: Hours after U.S. officials indicted Gautam Adani, one of India’s most successful businessmen, on fraud and conspiracy charges, Kenya’s president publicly backed away from lucrative infrastructure deals with Mr. Adani’s companies to overhaul Nairobi’s international airport and the country’s electricity grid.
articles.byline: By Alex Travelli and Abdi Latif Dahir
